title: City of Brass
data:
The **City of Brass** is a [special level](/wiki/Special_level "Special level") in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"). It is one of the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes"), appearing between the [Plane of Fire](/wiki/Plane_of_Fire "Plane of Fire") and [Plane of Water](/wiki/Plane_of_Water "Plane of Water").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Map](#Map)
- [2 Extraplanar merchant](#Extraplanar_merchant)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 See also](#See_also)
- [5 References](#References)

The level is a town with a river of [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava"), a [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"), and six [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") in the positions shown above.

Scattered around the level are twenty-four [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap"), three [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder"), a hostile [tourist](/wiki/Tourist_\(player_monster\) "Tourist (player monster)"), two peaceful [djinni](/wiki/Djinni "Djinni"), thirteen hostile djinni, thirten hostile [efreet](/index.php?title=Efreet\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Efreet (page does not exist)"), a peaceful [fire elemental](/wiki/Fire_elemental "Fire elemental"), eight hostile fire elementals, a hostile [fusion elemental](/wiki/Fusion_elemental "Fusion elemental"), a [fire vortex](/wiki/Fire_vortex "Fire vortex"), a peaceful [hell hound pup](/wiki/Hell_hound_pup "Hell hound pup"), three hostile [phoenixes](/index.php?title=Phoenix\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Phoenix (page does not exist)"), and ten hostile [salamanders](/wiki/Salamander "Salamander").

The [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") is somewhere on the left half of the level.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                            |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | [SpliceHack 1.1.0 monst.c L3632](https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/monst.c#L3632) |

Shops in the City of Brass are run by **extraplanar merchants**.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) They have a chance of being generated with a [katana](/wiki/Katana "Katana"), a [potion of full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing"), a [potion of hallucination](/wiki/Potion_of_hallucination "Potion of hallucination") and a [wand of speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Compared to regular [shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper"), extraplanar merchants have a higher level, stronger attacks, and similar behaviour.

## Strategy

You may need to enter or leave a shop on this level. You could bring a [mummy wrapping](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping "Mummy wrapping") so that you can enter and leave even if permanently [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible"). Alternatively, you can bring a pet strong enough to kill the merchants if they get in your way.

## See also

- [SpliceHack/Special levels](/wiki/SpliceHack/Special_levels "SpliceHack/Special levels")

html:
City of Brass

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The City of Brass is a special level in SpliceHack. It is one of the Elemental Planes, appearing between the Plane of Fire and Plane of Water.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Map
  • 2 Extraplanar merchant
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 See also
  • 5 References

Map

-----.....................}}}|......................................|....|..

The level is a town with a river of lava, a fountain, and six shops in the positions shown above.

Scattered around the level are twenty-four fire traps, three boulders, a hostile tourist, two peaceful djinni, thirteen hostile djinni, thirten hostile efreet, a peaceful fire elemental, eight hostile fire elementals, a hostile fusion elemental, a fire vortex, a peaceful hell hound pup, three hostile phoenixes, and ten hostile salamanders.

The magic portal is somewhere on the left half of the level.[2]

Extraplanar merchant

@ Extraplanar merchant (No tile)
Difficulty 23
Attacks Weapon 8d4, Weapon 8d4
@ Extraplanar merchant (No tile)
Difficulty 23
Attacks

Weapon 8d4, Weapon 8d4

Base level 20
Base experience ?
Speed 18
Base AC 0
Base MR 50
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

An extraplanar merchant:

  • does not breathe.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference SpliceHack 1.1.0 monst.c L3632

Shops in the City of Brass are run by extraplanar merchants.[3] They have a chance of being generated with a katana, a potion of full healing, a potion of hallucination and a wand of speed monster.[4] Compared to regular shopkeepers, extraplanar merchants have a higher level, stronger attacks, and similar behaviour.

Strategy

You may need to enter or leave a shop on this level. You could bring a mummy wrapping so that you can enter and leave even if permanently invisible. Alternatively, you can bring a pet strong enough to kill the merchants if they get in your way.

See also

  • SpliceHack/Special levels

References

  3. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/shknam.c#L718
  4. ↑ https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.1.0/src/makemon.c#L1052
